New Records: Mohammed Shami became the first Indian bowler to pick more than five-wicket haul in ODI World Cups.
Shubman Gill became the fastest to reach 2000 ODI runs.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 95 to steer India's successful run chase against New Zealand.
Mohammed Shami picked 5 for 54 off 10 overs.
Rohit Sharma hit 4 fours and 4 sixes in a 40-ball 46.
Shreyas Iyer was dismissed by Trent Boult's accurate short ball.
Suryakumar Yadav was run out after a relay throw was cleanly collected by Tom Latham.
Ravindra Jadeja hit the winning runs in the same over Kohli was dismissed.
Mohammed Siraj dismissed Devon Conway for a duck.
Mohammed Shami bowled Will Young with a peach of a delivery.
Rachin Ravindra and Daryl Mitchell added 159 for the third wicket.
Kuldeep Yadav redeemed himself with the wickets of Tom Latham and Glenn Phillips.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Play was halted briefly because of fog in Dharamshala.
India have chased all five times in this edition of the World Cup.
India next take on defending champions England in Lucknow on October 29.
